highlights: Supporting the Surface Training Advanced Virtual Environment Combat Systems (STAVE-CS) Virtual Maintenance Trainer (VMT) projects, a collection of Unity-based virtual world maintenance trainers.

Designing and developing the Operational Readiness Test System (ORTS) for the STAVE-CS VMT projects.  Leveraging real-world big data to dynamically construct a virtual ORTS based on the appropriate STAVE-CS VMT project.
Lead a small team of developers as well as manage a business relationship with Lockheed Martin engineers to assist with the development of ORTS for STAVE-CS VMT projects
Key developer for an internal group of assemblies that increase the overall stability and development speed across all STAVE-CS VMT projects.
Developed, optimized and redesigned their existing WordPress website which lead to an increase in client acquisition (https://www.masterswoodworkinginc.com/).
Currently undergoing a complete rework of the existing website with NextJS and Vercel (https://dev.masterswoodworkinginc.com/).
Designed, developed, and deployed the company’s website (https://www.citymechanical.com/).
Website developed with NextJS and Vercel (https://github.com/city-mechanical/city-mechanical-website)
Developed tools to optimize day to day operations for field and office employees
Designed, developed, and deployed the non-profit organization’s website (https://yghc.org/).
Created from the ground up with the WordPress platform.
Implemented a live Facebook feed and photo gallery.

projects.name: clutchd/ui
projects.description: A React component library built for Vercel, designed by Clutchd.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognized for earning a GPA of at least 3.5 in a term while completing at least 6 credits and maintained a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher.

awards.title: Magna Cum Laude
awards.summary: Recognized for graduating with a cumulative GPA of 3.901-3.999.
